suyūr.commentsEnglish:
Known in Tunis as Ṭabe' Al-Dhīl, also Ṭabe' al-Sharqī and Inqilāb al-'irāq.

The melodies that are close to the melodies of maqām rāst that can be utilised during composition or taqsīm are nahāwand, nawā athar, nikrīz or chahārgāh all on rāst, ṣabā ḥusaynī, ḥijāz nawā and bayāt nawā. Sometimes after chahārgāh, a transposition of segāh on rāst, then a return to chahārgāh and then to rāst.
Begins from the note rāst or yegāh and repeats the sayr from the qarār, then it ascends to nawā and above. In the end it descends to the qarār which is rāst.

Starts on the note chahārgāh or nawā and after a descent to the note rāst the ascent begins from nawā using jins ḥijāz until kurdān, then  ascend to muḥayyar, sunbuleh, jawāb chahārgāh (mahūran) until saham/ramal tūtī followed by a descent along it's scale degrees until its qarār which is rāst.

Starts from the note ḥijāz to render ḥijaz on nawā and it continues ascending until rendering nahāwand on kurdān. Then during the descent one renders nahāwand on nawā, then nawā on chahārgāh after which the note ḥusaynī is swapped for ḥiṣār and the descent continues until its qarār which is rāst, but before the end one must briefly utilise ḥijāz on yegāh.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts with ḥijāz dūgāh, followed by rāst nawā. Descending it uses būselīk nawā, followed by ḥijāz dūgāh and ends on 'irāq

Starts from rāst and plays jins chahārgāh on rāst until nawā. Then jins chahārgāh on chahārgāh ascending to render bayyātī on ḥusaynī, then rāst on kurdān. During descent it uses chahārgāh on kurdān instead of rāst, and touches nīm būselīk instead of segāh. Towards the end it uses yegāh and its qarār is rāst

name: maqām bayāt ḥusaynī
commentsArabic: TEST asdf asdf asdf asdf asdf

suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on 'iraq or dūgāh descending until yegāh, then bayāt dūgāh until nawā then rāst nawā and descends to the qarār which is 'irāq
Starts by ascending from rāst to nawā followed by ḥijāz on nawā the nahāwand on kurdān, it then descends with būselīk on nawā until the qarār which is rāst

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Sayr can start from chahārgāh or nawā, ascends and then descends until the qarār. Ascent is not defined, so it is assumed that it will be in jins rāst al-nawā following the construction of the maqām.

Begins on nawā, then ḥusaynī and 'ajam until muḥayyar ascending and descending, then descends from nawā until yegāh with a touch of qarār ḥijāz before ending on its qarār, yegāh. Therefore it is assumed that the initial ascents and descents are in jins nahāwand nawā as per the construction of the maqām. Also the note qarār ḥijāz does not exist in the list of note names provided by Shawwā in his book.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.

suyūr.commentsEnglish: nahāwand nawā, followed by ḥijāz dūgāh then the qarār, yegāh, with a touch of qarār ḥijāz

Start with jins bayāt on dūgāh, ending on 'irāq. Then ascend and descend ending on note 'ushayrān. Repeat jins bayāt on dūgāh, and descend to end on the qarār which is yegāh. This maqām name corresponds with a Persian Gushe also called Majlis Afrooz in the Dastgah Mahūr and Dastgāh Shūr. In Mahūr it bears no melodic or intervallic resemblance, but in Shūr the jins bayāt is prominent.

Start on nawā to huseinī and what's above it (jins kurd huseinī), then jins bayāt on dūgāh. After it's descent ascend bayāt dūgāh and during the descent use the note kurdī instead of segāh (i.e. jins kurd on dūgāh) and descend to end on yegāh using a touch of qarār ḥijāz.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Begins on nawā to develop bayāt on dūgāh, then bayāt 'ushayrān and upon reaching muḥayyar in the ascent, it descends until dūgāh using 'ajam instead of awj (jins kurd ḥusaynī) and its qarār is 'ushayrān.
etetwet
Starts on nawā to render maqām bayāt al-dūgāh and descends to ʿushayrān to render maqām bayāt al-ḥusaynī and descends stepwise until it's qarār ʿushayrān.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts with bayāt on ḥusaynī followed by nikrīz on rāst and returns to bayāt al-ḥusaynī so it's tonal centre is ḥusaynī but they have today made it's qarār ʿushayrān
Starts on ḥiṣār to render ḥijāz  on ḥusaynī followed by maqām nawā athar al-dūgāh then ḥijāz on ʿushayrān and it ends on its qarār ʿushayrān

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahārgāh to render maqām ṣabā on dūgāh with a highlighting of maqām ḥijāz on chahārgāh, then ascending to render bayāt on muḥayyar followed by a descent in nahāwand on nawā followed by kurdī on dūgāh and it ends on its qarār with a rendering of maqām kurdī on ʿushayrān. In modern Turkish it is known as makam Şevkutarab.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: There is a discrepancy in Shawwā's representation of this maqām. In the "rules" section it says: Starts on ḥijaz to render rāst al-dūgāh then ascends to muḥayyar and during the descent 'ajam is used to render bayāt dūgāh then kurd on dūgāh then ḥijaz on dūgāh and it ends on 'ushayrān. But in the "analysis" section it says: First, jins bayāt 'ushayrān, second, jins rāst dūgāh, third, bayāt ḥusaynī. Then ascend to render bayāt muḥayyar and descend to render rāst nawā, followed by kurdī or ḥijāz dūgāh, then nikrīz rāst and ends with bayāt 'ushayrān. Rāst dūgāh does not render in most tuning systems, and the note ḥijāz doesn't comply with it's jins. Needs to be researched

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahārgāh ascending to kurdān and above to render ḥijāz chahārgāh, then descends from chahārgāh until it's qarār 'ajam 'ushayrān

Starts on kurdān ascending to jawāb nawā (saham/ramal tuti) then descends from nawā to its qarār using chahārgāh and kurdī. In the "analysis" it states that one must descend at the end to qarār ḥijāz before ending on 'ajam 'ushayrān.

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Starts on chahārgāh until nawā to render bayāt dūgāh, followed by rāst nawā, followed by bayāt muḥayyar, then descends to render rāst nawā, followed by nahāwand nawā, followed by bayāt dūgāh and from dūgāh descends until the qarār which is 'irāq.

"Rules": Starts with rāst on dūgāh then descends to 'irāq and from there descends to yegāh and then ends on the qarār, 'irāq. Note: maqām bayāt muḥayyar should be rendered during the ascent. An alternative sayr is to start on awj to render rāst kurdān, then 'irāq on awj, then descending until its qarār, 'irāq."Analysis": jins segāh on 'irāq, jins rāst on dūgāh, jins bayāt on muhayyar, then descends until 'irāq. Slightly conflicting directions. Must be clarified.
Starts on ṣabā dūgāh and it's qarār is irāq

Rules: Starts on 'ajam and ascends to awj then descends to segāh, the ascends to to shahnāz and muḥayyar, and upon descent it ends on 'irāq. Analysis: nagham awj ara on 'irāq, jins musta'ār on segāh, jins awj on awj, descends according to its pitch classes until the qarār ('irāq)

suyūr.sourceEnglish: Al-Qawa’id Al-Faniyya Fi Al-musica Al-Sharqiyyah Wal Gharbiyyah. Cairo: Jibra’īl Jabrā.
suyūr.commentsEnglish: Rules: Starts on kurdī to segāh and continues ascending to nawā, then from nawā ascends to buzurk, then descends to segāh and from segāh to it's qarār 'iraq. Analysis: jins awj arā on 'irāq, jins nagham musta'ār on segāh, jins būselīk on nawā then ascends until buzurk and descends stepwise until it's qarār

Starts from rāst until nawā using zirgūleh ascending and descending, then it uses dūgāh in place of zirgūleh and continues with the same sayr as maqām sōznāk and its qarār is rāst.

It also has another sayr which is to starts on ḥijaz to render maqām shat 'arabān and then it ends on its qarār which is rāst
Starts with a transposition of maqām ṣabā on ḥusaynī, then rāst on nawā then, bayyātī on dūgāh and it's qarār ends on ʿirāq. Sometimes it starts bayyātī on ḥusaynī instead of ṣabā.
This maqām starts from the upper octave, from kurdān or nīm mahūr and during it's descent it uses a brief chahārgāh on rāst and another brief nikrīz on rāst and ends on its qarār which is rāst

Starts from rāst ascending to nawā to render maqām rāst on nawā, then it ascends to kurdān. After that it descends to its qarār through maqām nahāwand on nawā and then it descends from nawā to rāst by highlighting the maqām sāzkār. It is compulsory to bring out maqām segāh before the closure. It's qarār is rāst.

Starts from kurdān and ascends until saham/ramal tūtī using sunbuleh and jawāb ḥijāz, then it returns descending until its qarār. During the descent its possible to use nahāwand on nawā then from nawā the descent continues until the qarār using maqām nikrīz followed by rāst.
